Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: I developed a much greater way of writing. This class really made me contemplate the organization of my papers to make sure they really make sense to the reader. My skill of writing in a concise way has also increased tremendously. My creativity was also really showcased in that the instructor really appreciated the original ideas I tried to bring to the assignments. My analysis of different pieces of writing has also improved, and I learned how to really write a well-developed research paper. My love of writing has also been even more solidified than it was before!
Throughout this course, I have learned to effectively shorten my thoughts when writing and to keep the information as concise as possible.
I developed a much stronger and refined understanding of the methods of crafting an analytical paper.
I developed the skill to become an improved writer by incorporating different tactics when building my thesis and body paragraphs.
I learned how to write with a certain claim, to construct a proper research paper, and to use different writing skills to support an argument

I was able to improve my writing abilities and I was able to learn how to properly write a research essay as well as a proper personal essay. I was able to come to class and work on my discussion abilities while engaging with my classmates and learning their opinions and views of the course material which in this case was the definition of family.
I became a much better writer and now analyze literature better as well.

There were definitely a lot of strengths to this course. The readings were extremely interesting and well picked. They showcased multiple aspects of family in that they were all very different and unique in their own ways; they were all a joy to read. The different kinds of assignments were very helpful as well because now I know how to write a variety of different things well. The activities could be a little repetitive which could make class a little dull sometimes, but this was probably good in the long run because it really brought the points about writing well home.

The strengths of this class were the variety of writings that the students were able to explore. Also, the different readings exposed students to a wide variety of writing styles, allowing us to figure out our own styles.
I found this course to be very good at fostering discussion about texts as well as creating a sense of camaraderie and support among the students.
Strengths: good variety of assignments-- video project at end of class, start and end class with free-write, readings, peer editing, etc,.
The course was very well organized with the papers and the readings

it was great having readings that were manageable and interesting, it kept people engaged with the material in a donut of class. It was also great hint the rough drafts and the final drafts of the essays due for each of the assignments so that we could get feedback and allow students to get their work done in a timely manor.
This was an overall great course.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student because it really improves your writing skills. Although, it's set up in a way that makes improving your writing interesting because you're learning about a very intriguing and universal topic. It's also a great way to come up with your own ideas and figure out how to get them across to readers in a unique and effective way.
Yes, if they are wishing to improve their writing abilities.
Absolutely!!

Yes, I would recommend this course to another student. The workload is not too excessive, there is variety in the course, and the topics we cover and discussions we have are very interesting, as family is such a broad topic and every student brings a unique perspective to the table.
I would recommend this course to another student because it helps improve your writing in many different ways

I would definitely recommend this class to another student. The workload was manageable but there was still a significant amount and the class never got dull. It was well structured and the deadlines were very clear. It was also beneficial to be able to constantly receive feedback from our teacher and peers. the class material was relevant and interesting.
I would recommend this class. The open discussions on readings and the writing prompts were great.
